meanings.definition: To engage in a boxing match or practice fight.
meanings.sent1: The two friends sparred playfully in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The boxers sparred in the ring before the main event.
meanings.sent3: The siblings sparred over who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The candidates sparred fiercely during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The students sparred with gloves on, learning the basics of boxing.

meanings.sent1: The siblings sparred over which TV show to watch.
meanings.sent2: The colleagues sparred over the best approach to the project.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors sparred good-naturedly about whose lawn was greener.
meanings.sent4: The politicians sparred over the new policy proposal.
meanings.sent5: The friends sparred over the bill, each insisting on paying.

meanings.definition: To provide or reinforce with spars.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter sparred the structure to make it more sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The shipbuilder sparred the hull for added support.
meanings.sent3: The coach sparred the team's defense with extra drills.
meanings.sent4: The engineer sparred the bridge to withstand strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The gardener sparred the plants to prevent them from bending.
